description:
We should support images that are compressed.  In particular, this is useful for raw images, which be 8G but mostly zeroes, and compress down to e.g. 250MB.

Qcow is sparse, but isn't compressed I believe.
title: Support compressed raw images

comments.content:
We should support images that are compressed.  In particular, this is useful for raw images, which be 8G but mostly zeroes, and compress down to e.g. 250MB.

Qcow is sparse, but isn't compressed I believe.

comments.content: I'd like to target this as "Wishlist" for Diablo / Design Summit approval, but can't seem to do that.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~justin-fathomdb

comments.content:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/837100 "fixes" this by uncompressing compressed qcow images on launch, and states :

"
The user may want to use compressed disk images for transmission, but it is unlikely that they want to incur the overhead cost of all reads to that disk going through a cpu decompression.

I suggest that if an image is a compressed disk, it should be decompressed before being used as a backing device.
"

Is this sufficient support for compressed images for you?

comments.content: I think we can consider this one resolved now.
